group_1.textLeft: Cornelia and Amaryllis are meeting in@the temple with the emperor-to-be…

group_1.textRight: Is it going okay…?
We must believe.
All we can do is maintain watch outside.

group_1.textLeft: And after the meeting, there's the picnic@this afternoon, right?

group_1.textRight: Correct. Amaryllis and Cornelia are@on a very tight schedule.

group_1.textCenter: No need for pleasantries.@Let's get right to business.

group_1.textRight: Y-yes…!

group_1.textLeft: Plinius happened to be in the area@and informed me of something…
"The imperator will die and Mount Vesuvius@will burn."
Such is the sinister prophecy spreading@from the mouths of insolents…
*Chuckle* I'm not looking to incriminate you.
I simply want to hear the details,
as the one who will eventually rule the@Roman provinces in my father's stead.

group_1.textRight: Consul Titus…!

group_1.textLeft: Plinius is an inscrutable man whose@behavior is puzzling at times.
He deemed your stories worth heeding@in his own peculiar way…
Perhaps he even found them credible,
else he would not have deigned to@slip them in my ear.

group_1.textRight: In that case…allow me to explain.

group_1.textLeft: Titus, the next emperor…@What kind of person is he…?

group_1.textRight: He is the current emperor's eldest son,@as well as his right-hand man.
Next year, in June 79 CE, he will assume@the throne after his father's death.
This historical fact has been handed@down to the present day,
and is in precise agreement with@Amaryllis's testimony.
From our knowledge in the future,
Titus was the Roman emperor on the day@Pompeii was destroyed.
He was an able ruler who swiftly dealt@with the ensuing disasters,
and was allegedly popular among@the public.

group_1.textLeft: There was something else Amaryllis@brought up, yeah?
Something about a Jewish princess…?

group_1.textRight: Yes, his love affair with Berenice,
a story so famous that it was later@turned into a play.
Titus currently has a lover, Princess Berenice,@the daughter of a Jewish royal family.
But for the next emperor of Rome to take@a foreign princess as his wife…
The people are vehemently opposed,@to say the least.

group_1.textLeft: Er, then…what's gonna happen after this?

group_1.textRight: If history goes as we know,
the two will never be married. Titus will@become the next emperor,
and is said to have remained single@until the end of his days.

group_1.textLeft: …I see.
One year from now, on June 23, my father@will die and I will become Imperator…
You're certain of this?

group_1.textRight: Yes…!

group_1.textLeft: Then the truth of your prophecy will reveal@itself then.
I will reserve judgment for the time being.
Assuming the prophecy does come true,@I will then heed what you have to say.

group_1.textRight: But then there won't be much time@before the mountain goes aflame!
I must be frank, I really would prefer@you exert your authority right away.
Ideally, I'd have everyone in the city@transferred to another region…

group_1.textLeft: You mentioned the eruption would occur@on October 24, yes?

group_1.textRight: Correct.

group_1.textLeft: That's just four months after I become@Imperator…

group_1.textRight: Given we know the precise date,
if we could order a prompt evacuation,@everyone's lives will be saved…!

group_1.textLeft: I see…
Or perhaps we could deploy the military@in advance…

group_1.textRight: The military...?!
Consul Titus…!
